comments.commentBody: Who cares if the yanks are not in it?
Fear the beard.
Wasn't this supposed to be a pitching duel??? After watching the Rangers pitchers collapse one after the other I was half expecting Nolan Ryan to jump in.
Yeah Timmy! Go boys. Big upset if they can pull it off

Quite pleasing that the Giants have beaten the greatest pitcher the world has ever seen.

I hope to never hear again the fatuous remarks of Tim McCarver.
Misfits unite!

I wonder if it would not have been better for the Democrats if Obama had focused on stemming the loss of independents instead of phony pep rallies aimed at the base.

A lot of the people posting here at the good old NTY seem to think that the voters can’t see and can’t read and don’t know that you think they are unwashed barbarians or ignorant racists who in a decent society would be allowed to vote at all.

The voters can see and they can read and they know what you think of them. When the voters see Obama rallying his base what they also see is Obama pandering to the very people who think they are scum.

Say what you will about Republicans and the Tea Party, their complaints are much more focused on ideas and their comments are just not as nasty and ad hominem the ones routinely posted here.

This is propaganda. The people that wasted their votes on Obama, were desperate for change after the 8 distructive years of Republican ruin. Those people would NEVER put this country in the hands of the Republicans EVER...

Not sure how you came to this conclusion. I read the questions and answers carefully, and my impression is that the entire concept of a Republican sweep is in the MEDIA's Imagination. Especially Questions 30-33 clearly show people aren't buying MSM's anti-Obama fiction.

Anybody who would vote Republican in this election after the Bush administration nearly brought down our entire economic system needs to be on medication because you are all out of your ever loving minds!
President Obama has only been in office for 21 months how in the hell can he be expected to fix everything after what the Bush/Cheney administration did in 94 months?
The deficit we have today is mostly due two wars that Bush got us into that were not paid for. The ten year tax cut for the rich, tax cuts to corporations who take their businesses overseas tax cuts for corporations who outsource their labor. The bailout money was given to the Banks, AIG, Fannie Mae Freddie Mac, Tarp, under the Bush administration. The housing market failed because of deregulation of the markets by the Bush administration if you want more of this go ahead and vote Republican. The result a catastrophic financial melt down that will take decades to come back from instead of a few years that we now face with President Obama.

Well of course. He ignored the feelings of the people with ObamaCAre, forced it down our throats and not one representative can even tell you whats really in it.  He ignored a year ago August town hall meetings, he lied about keeping your insurance, as companeis think about paying the fine rather then offering insurance at all.  It will increase the deficit especailly i years 12 and out.  He turned bankruptcy law upside down when he took over GM and put the unions in fromt of the creditors; he lied about ACCORN and uses the SEIU union as the modern day brown shirts.  He tells Latinos to "punish" republicans, he practicies politcs of race; has taken 6 vacations n two years, puts on another 3 trillion in debt in two years, that our kids and their kids will have to pay for.  Blows off Iranian students who tried to protest the illegal govt their.  His first 3 months flies all over the world to apologize for America. A stimulius bill that did nothing.  He is one of the most inexperienced Presidents we have ever had, but he sure does enjoy Air Force 1 doesn't he.

I just can't for the life of me, understand how any one thinks that republicans will be better about holding down deficit spending. Where in the world do folks get the idea, that with their history, the republicans care one wit about the deficit. Every republican administration since Regan has not only increased the dificit by record amounts, they have bragged about it as a good thing in some cases. The MSM has a tendancy to play republican talking points more often by almost double, and people believe the crap that they are putting out there. People are stupid! Republicans have proved that they don't care about Americans getting jobs by blocking legislation that the democrats have tried to put forward for that purpose. This poll doesn't surprise me, it just reinforces the idea that our public education has been in trouble for much longer than any one wants to admit. I run into people every day, who when questioned about their opininions, can't provide any basis for why they believe any of the misconceptions they have about the Obama administration and the president himself. Too many people are willing to believe what they hear on TV and radio or read on the internet. I've noticed that most people who have strong conservative beliefs get most of their information from one news station or source or from one internet source and rarely research anything they learn in this way. People are much too lazy when wanting to understand what their leaders are doing. I keep hoping that these polls are skewed by organizations who want the truth to be hidden from view, but I think there are simply too many lemmings in our country.

So Wait, - the last 2 years is worse than the eight before it?

Is this country THAT dumb?

Sigh! If there is any validity to this poll, I feel outrage, but mostly sad.  I also feel disappointed in some of the comments.  I continue to be in disbelief about our collective short attention span, shallow allegiances, instant gratification reflex, disregard for integrity and truth: and the systems & players that contribute to this outrageous state of affairs. We need our leaders, justices, legislators, journalists, etc.  to be role models for fairness & honesty; and for citizens to transcend their single issue politics. Why can't we grow up and wake up?  What gets in the way? Let's reflect on that.  I give the current administration a lot of credit, even if I don't agree with everything.  This administration has made a difference for women, minorities, and with respect for religious values and differences, plus a whole lot more.  I still have on my refrigerator a DSCC sticker that says "CHANGE BEGINS WITH ME."  Pouting or blaming Obama is largely emotional reactivity, not very reasoned.  Blinding ourselves to current or recent past administrative or legislative decisions is ignorance.  I'd rather we acknowledge the sadness of this situation, then call people stupid and inane.  I live in Wisconsin, I am a woman with Catholic roots and I can assure you that I am voting for Russ Feingold, Ron Kind, Tom Barrett and good strong democratic candidates running for state offices.

A recent picture this week showed Sarah Palin at a Tea Party rally, child in hand, holding a signed which stated, "Party like its 1773."

If the American public, especially, the majority of white Americans; who are not part of today's ruling, upper middle-class to astoundingly wealthy, well-educated people, would recall that in 1773 most of them were not allowed to be involved in the political process or have the ability to elect an official to office [If I'm incorrect, please correct me].

I, being African-American, well, we all know what my condition or state would have been like in "1773 America:" someone's property & not considered a human being.

What is my point? As many have said, Americans (especially, all of us who are not in that group listed in my 2nd paragraph - the 99% who don't control over 90% of this country's wealth) should really take the time to recount its history and ask yourself - would I be better off going back to 1773?, as Ms. Palin advocates.

The DRIFT seems in part driven by many who are succumbing to personal fears based on (1) prejudices, esp. race - having a biracial President, (2) an inability to accept or support change that challenges your world-view and selfishness, (3) a willingness to support candidates with "some extreme views,"[extreme views have kept people not like the wealthy from voting, people enslaved and prevented women from voting, etc.], (4) lack of memory of repeatedly failing Republican agendas which have never supported the average, hardworking American, but creates policies & programs which have been fiscally detrimental to American economic growth and future fiscal health, and (5) unbelievably, a willingness to follow a "party - Tea Party" whose agenda is based in emotions, rather than sound, intellectual and articulated economic, social or political policies.

America has been ADRIFT from the recent economic storm brought upon us by a failed administration, but more so due to its NEGLECT of the 99% who, as I’ve said, were not like them: BUSH/CHENEY - wealthy! So America, caution should be given before casting a vote to a party or “mob” who would want to take you back to a time, 1773 or recent, when the majority of us really had no one working on our behalf.

Pls stop citing Katrina. Obama's response to the Gulf Oil spill was slower, less decisive, beyond useless. Totally a federal a problem which he completely fumbled. While Katrina was more a state and city problem which Dems in control fumbled, (while Bush didn't do so great himself). If the Gulf Oil Spill was on land, the pictures would be every bit as damning and the destruction to property and people even worse. He just got lucky.

I just love the responses to this article. Bush was Appointed! Republicans are for Fat Cats! Republicans are the Party of No! 30 years of Reagan/Gingrich/Bush economic horror. We need more time to make things better! What these responders don't realize is that this poll's findings show is that people are saying:
1. Bush isn't running, get over him.
2. Who is paying for all these Obama $35k-per-plate fundraisers, fat cat Republicans?
3. If you find an idea to be wrong, "No" is an appropriate response.
4. The first 26 of those 30 years of "economic horror" were pretty darn good, actually. It wasn't until after Nancy and Harry took over Congress that things went into the toilet.
5. More time for what? You watched unemployment rise from 7% to almost 10% over the past two years. As we were losing our jobs and our homes, you passed a "stimulus" package that did nothing to help us get work and save our homes. Then you decided to worry about an insurance takeover instead of us losing our jobs and our homes. Then you wasted time discussing Cap and Trade, which would actually make it harder for us to find jobs and save our homes. Then you decided to sue a State for enforcing a Federal Law, instead worrying about our jobs and homes. Then you decided to let our tax rates rise next year instead of compromising with the opposition. Finally, you failed to pass a budget, the ONLY thing that the Constitution actually requires you to do. Now you say Vote For Us and we might get around to what's important for you. You really wonder why so many people are upset with you?

Republican/Corporate backed Fox News Disinformation Channel lying to the public 24/7/365 in action.

Rupert Murdoch is the most dangerous alien that has ever entered this country in it's history.

The National Debt Debate

FDR dramatically increased the national debt as a means of getting through WWII without losing WWII. Successive administrations, both democratic and republican exhibited surprising discipline over the decades necessary to whittle the national debt down to something manageable. And, it WAS manageable until Reagan/Bush and Bush/Quayle. The Clinton administration resumed fiscal discipline but Bush/Cheney threw it all away by deregulating the insurance, banking, investment industries and spoon-feeding the military-industrial complex that Eisenhower warned us about.

At the time, it seemed prudent to increase the national debt rather than lose to Hitler, Mussolini and the Japanese. Successive administrations struggled (successfully) to manage that debt, the standard of living increased and America actually experienced unparalleled prosperity while that debt was being whittled away. With the condition of the banking and investment industries at the time, it was the only economic tool that FDR had available to him. So, he used it.

It took my and my parent’s entire generation to pay down that national debt but, my parents’ generation had no problem in laying down their very lives to fight the Axis countries and I had no problem with paying the debt that they created. In a way, it was my inherited contribution to winning WWII. Interestingly, during the generations that were paying off FDRs national debt, America experienced unparalleled prosperity.

Obama is simply using the same tool that FDR successfully used to get us out of this economic mess. Obama didn’t create this mess. He inherited it. That’s a historical fact. And, if the national debt goes to record highs it only means that Obama’s predecessors screwed up proportionately. It also means that, although Obama’s predecessors created the current fiscal crisis for less than noble reasons, it still remains my children’s responsibility to pay off what I cannot pay off.

If anyone is interested in learning the facts of who created the national debt, they can simply Google ‘history of the national debt’. You will find that when Obama took office, the national debt was already over $9 trillion. And, like FDR before him, given the condition of the investment and banking industries as well as the rest of the economy, it is the only economic tool that he has. And, he’s using it.

We have an immediate problem. Without going further into debt, this country will not economically survive. It is important to look at the national debt differently. Look at it as an economic tool. How high will the national debt go? Who knows? Who cares? It’s almost irrelevant. What is certain is that if it’s not used effectively as an economic tool, many of you will NEVER WORK AGAIN.

Debt didn’t get us into this mess. Four things did:

Exporting jobs by enacting unfavorable trade legislation like NAFTA
Fighting stupid wars for the benefit of oil companies and government contractors
Deregulating the insurance, banking and investment industries
Spoon feeding the Military-Industrial complex

You might ask yourself this: Who benefited by getting us into this situation?

Shocking, just shocking, that Americans do not appreciate having all of their thinking done for them by the czars in DC. Don't they LIKE having to pay for their formerly free checking accounts (that are soon to be accessible to the "Department of Consumer Affairs" so that the Dept. can see if people are using their own money wisely)? Don't they LIKE having to get a prescription for an over-the-counter NSAID so they can pay for it out of their FSA account from their overly-generous employer-sponsored health plan that will soon have its benefits cut because the plan exceeds the government-mandated norm?

Don't they LIKE being told that they are stupid if they dare to disagree with the president, the speaker of the house, or the senate majority leader? Don't they KNOW that Colonel Obaaamaaa knows what is best for his sheep? How dare they disapprove of what the elites want! Next thing you know, the people will be protesting by not expanding their businesses, not purchasing anything other than the necessities of life, and treading water.

Oh, wait, they're doing that already. Wow, these sheep learn faster than we thought!

Vote in the small-minded, mean-spirited repubs that let the nation go to hell in a handbasket over the eight years of W? Not this Roman Catholic. Not this woman. How much worse are people willing to let things get? To vote against the common good, which is what such a vote represents, I consider a sin.
I am attaching about four or five staplers to each wrist.  I'll be Edward Staplerhands.
Every single pickup suggestion is a QB, and I'm running out of healthy WRs! Argh!

Obama's promises:
Clean coal technology
Repeal NAFTA
Hold unempolyment to 8%
Immigration reform... I guess he meant he'd get tough with Arizona
Get tough with the "Wall Street fatcats"...

Face it, Obama is nothing but a flim-flam artist.

BTW a Democratic President signed NAFTA, normalized trade relations with China and signed the repeal of Glass-Steagall. Way to go Bill.

All those folks who have not given President the time to repair the ills from the Bush administration are in for a rude awakening. Folks wake up! This country nearly collapsed right before he was elected .The auto industry nearly collapsed too. For those of you who think the Republicans are going to make things better brace yourselves.  Go ahead and take things backwards ! Just be honest when you see that you have made a mistake. The conservatives do not have a productive agenda. but obviously so many of you think they do. Just wait and see!
